appDesc.message: Save a list of all open tabs into a text file.

optionsFormatCustomTabDescription.message:
You can define a custom tab format instead of the default "Include titles" one.

You can use any combination of characters and the following special blocks:

  • {title}: title of a tab
  • {url}: URL of a tab
  • {window-id}: ID of the window containing a tab
  • {tab-group}: name of the tab's group (empty if ungrouped)
  • \r\n: new line

Example: [{title}]({url})\r\n

optionsIgnoreNonHTTPDescription.message: This option prevents Export Tabs URLs from listing tabs whose URL scheme is different from http:// or https://.

optionsIgnorePinnedDescription.message: This option prevents Export Tabs URLs from listing pinned tabs.

optionsFilterTabsDescription.message:
This option adds a filtering feature to Export Tabs URLs.

Both the title and URL are searched against (even if not displayed).

You can use regular expressions.

Example:

  • fe?ather: matches both father and feather
  • (stackoverflow|github).com: matches both stackoverflow.com and github.com

optionsCustomGlobalHeaderDescription.message:
You may define a custom global header here.

You can use any combination of characters and the following special blocks:

  • {num-tabs}: number of tabs
  • {date}: current date (YYYY-MM-DD)
  • {time}: current time (HH:mm:SS)
  • {utc-offset}: UTC offset (e.g. +01:00)
  • \r\n: new line

Example: Exported on {date} at {time} (# links: {num-tabs})\r\n

optionsGroupByDescription.message: When enabled, exported tabs are organized into sections with headers.

copiedToClipboard.message: The list has successfully been copied to your clipboard.

notCopiedToClipboard.message: An error has occured while trying to copy the list to your clipboard.
